db:abstract.db:para: The QGradient class is used in combination with QBrush to specify gradient fills.

db:listitem.db:para: QGradient is part of Painting Classesshared

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Qt currently supports three types of gradient fills:

db:listitem.db:para: Linear gradients interpolate colors between start and end points.
Simple radial gradients interpolate colors between a focal point and end points on a circle surrounding it.
Extended radial gradients interpolate colors between a center and a focal circle.
Conical gradients interpolate colors around a center point.

db:section.db:para: A gradient's type can be retrieved using the type() function. Each of the types is represented by a subclass of QGradient:

The colors in a gradient are defined using stop points of the QGradientStop type; i.e., a position and a color. Use the setColorAt() function to define a single stop point. Alternatively, use the setStops() function to define several stop points in one go. Note that the latter function replaces the current set of stop points.

It is the gradient's complete set of stop points (accessible through the stops() function) that describes how the gradient area should be filled. If no stop points have been specified, a gradient of black at 0 to white at 1 is used.
A diagonal linear gradient from black at (100, 100) to white at (200, 200) could be specified like this:
A gradient can have an arbitrary number of stop points. The following would create a radial gradient starting with red in the center, blue and then green on the edges:

It is possible to repeat or reflect the gradient outside its area by specifiying the spread method using the setSpread() function. The default is to pad the outside area with the color at the closest stop point. The currently set spread method can be retrieved using the spread() function. The QGradient::Spread enum defines three different methods:

Note that the setSpread() function only has effect for linear and radial gradients. The reason is that the conical gradient is closed by definition, i.e. the conical gradient fills the entire circle from 0 - 360 degrees, while the boundary of a radial or a linear gradient can be specified through its radius or final stop points, respectively.

The gradient coordinates can be specified in logical coordinates, relative to device coordinates, or relative to object bounding box coordinates. The coordinate mode can be set using the setCoordinateMode() function. The default is LogicalMode, where the gradient coordinates are specified in the same way as the object coordinates. To retrieve the currently set coordinate mode use coordinateMode().

db:section.db:title: [since 4.4] enum QGradient::CoordinateMode
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies how gradient coordinates map to the paint device on which the gradient is used.

db:td.db:para: This is the default mode. The gradient coordinates are specified logical space just like the object coordinates.
In this mode the gradient coordinates are relative to the bounding rectangle of the paint device, with (0,0) in the top left corner, and (1,1) in the bottom right corner of the paint device.

In this mode the gradient coordinates are relative to the bounding rectangle of the object being drawn, with (0,0) in the top left corner, and (1,1) in the bottom right corner of the object's bounding rectangle.

db:section.db:para: This enum was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: enum QGradient::Spread
db:section.db:para: Specifies how the area outside the gradient area should be filled.

db:td.db:para: The area is filled with the closest stop color. This is the default.
The gradient is repeated outside the gradient area.
The gradient is reflected outside the gradient area.

db:section.db:title: enum QGradient::Type
db:section.db:para: Specifies the type of gradient.

db:td.db:para: Interpolates colors between start and end points (QLinearGradient).
Interpolate colors between a focal point and end points on a circle surrounding it (QRadialGradient).
Interpolate colors around a center point (QConicalGradient).

db:section.db:title: [since 4.4] QGradient::CoordinateMode QGradient::coordinateMode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the coordinate mode of this gradient. The default mode is LogicalMode.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: void QGradient::setColorAt(qreal position, const QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: Creates a stop point at the given position with the given color. The given position must be in the range 0 to 1.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.4] void QGradient::setCoordinateMode(QGradient::CoordinateMode mode)
db:section.db:para: Sets the coordinate mode of this gradient to mode. The default mode is LogicalMode.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: void QGradient::setSpread(QGradient::Spread method)
db:section.db:para: Specifies the spread method that should be used for this gradient.
Note that this function only has effect for linear and radial gradients.

db:section.db:title: void QGradient::setStops(const QGradientStops &stopPoints)
db:section.db:para: Replaces the current set of stop points with the given stopPoints. The positions of the points must be in the range 0 to 1, and must be sorted with the lowest point first.

db:section.db:title: QGradient::Spread QGradient::spread() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the spread method use by this gradient. The default is PadSpread.

db:section.db:title: QGradientStops QGradient::stops() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the stop points for this gradient.
If no stop points have been specified, a gradient of black at 0 to white at 1 is used.

db:section.db:title: QGradient::Type QGradient::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of gradient.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] bool QGradient::operator!=(const QGradient &gradient) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the gradient is the same as the other gradient specified; otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: bool QGradient::operator==(const QGradient &gradient) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the gradient is the same as the other gradient specified; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QGradientStop
db:section.db:para: Typedef for QPair<qreal, QColor>.

db:section.db:title: QGradientStops
db:section.db:para: Typedef for QVector<QGradientStop>.
